refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: neon is an HTTP and WebDAV client library. The major abstractions exposed are the HTTP session, created by ; and the HTTP request, created by . HTTP authentication is handled transparently for server and proxy servers, see ; complete SSL/TLS support is also included, see .

refsect1.title: Conventions
refsect1.para: Some conventions are used throughout the neon API, to provide a consistent and simple interface; these are documented below.

refsect2.title: Thread-safeness and global initialization
refsect2.para: &neon; itself is implemented to be thread-safe (avoiding any use of global state), but in some configurations makes use of other libraries which require global initialization. The function should be called before any other use of the &neon; library interface.

refsect2.title: Namespaces
refsect2.para: The neon header files reserve the use of the prefixes ne_ and NE_.

refsect2.title: URI paths, WebDAV metadata
refsect2.para: The path strings passed to any function must be URI-encoded by the application: &neon; never performs any URI encoding or decoding automatically. WebDAV property names and values must be used un UTF-8.

refsect2.title: Memory handling
refsect2.para: neon does not attempt to cope gracefully with an out-of-memory situation; instead, by default, abort is called to terminate the application. Optionally an application-provided function be called before abort; see .

refsect2.title: Callbacks and userdata
refsect2.para: Whenever a callback is registered, a userdata variable is also used to allow the application to associate a context with the callback. The userdata is of type void *, allowing any pointer to be used.
